Browse the full code from the August RUG:

```{r Load Libraries and Data, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
#Packages and libraries
library(tidyverse)
library(lattice)

#Loading data
data1<-mtcars
data2<-read.csv("datasets/ttest.csv")
data3<-read.csv("datasets/ANOVA.csv")
data4<-read.csv("datasets/correl.csv")

#Creating objects
Y<-mtcars$mpg
X<-mtcars$wt
```

```{r Explore the data}
#Basic exploration of data
View(data1)
str(data1)
```
```{r Descriptive Stats for all variables}
#Descriptive statistics for all variables
summary(data1)
```

```{r Visualise the data}
#Descriptive stats plots per variable
histogram(Y)#same than histogram(data$Y) or histogram(~Y,data)
```
```{r Box and Whisker Plot}
bwplot(Y)
```

```{r Inferential Statistics}
#Inferential statistics

#two sample t-test
t.test(time~daytime,data2)
```

```{r Visualise ANOVA}
#ANOVA aov(Y ~ X, data)
ggplot(data3)+
  aes(mode, students, group = mode)+
  geom_boxplot()
```

```{r ANOVA Output}
summary(aov(students~mode,data=data3))
```

```{r Visualise Relational Data}
#Relationship
#Scatterplot
xyplot(FXRUSD~FXREUR,data4)
```

```{r Correlation}
#correlation (Pearson)
cor(data4$FXRUSD,data4$FXREUR,method="pearson")
#correlation (Spearman)
cor(data4$FXRUSD,data4$FXREUR,method="spearman")
```

```{r Linear Regression}
#linear regression
lm(FXRUSD~FXREUR,data4)
```

You can find the [full raw code and datasets here](https://github.com/Nijawi/uqrug/tree/main/posts/2023-08-30-August-Stats/datasets).
